stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Federal and County Agencies Targeted with Pleasantly Surprised Emails
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 10 March 2015, US Government and county-level government agencies received phishing emails from paul.castro@comcast.net with the subject "Pleasantly Surprised". The emails included the malicious attachment Pleasantly surprised.zip (MD5: 69A2F92A33B8BD9740434DE3F95F4332), which contained the Gh0st remote administration tool (RAT).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
This is the first of two email examples included in the report. Each email included the same .zip archive attachment named "Pleasantly surprised.zip" (MD5: 69A2F92A33B8BD9740434DE3F95F4332).
----- START EMAIL HEADER ONE ----- Received: from resomta-ch2-11v.sys.comcast.net ([69.252.207.107]) by resqmta-ch2-12v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id 1oS81q0032Ka2Q501oSabg; Tue, 10 Mar 2015 12:26:34 +0000 Received: from resmail-ch2-197v.sys.comcast.net ([162.150.48.231]) by resomta-ch2-11v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id 1oSa1q00J4zH2Z601oSa9C; Tue, 10 Mar 2015 12:26:34 +0000 Date: Tue, 10 Mar 2015 12:26:33 +0000 (UTC) From: paul.castro@comcast.net To: [REDACTED] Message-ID: <1762859182.2432608.1425990393852.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> In-Reply-To: <1680146687.2432356.1425990366956.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> Subject: Pleasantly surprised MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_2432604_1426149379.1425990393844" X-Originating-IP: [::ffff:67.229.225.82] X-Mailer: Zimbra 8.0.7_GA_6031 (ZimbraWebClient - FF36 (Win)/8.0.7_GA_6031) Thread-Topic: Pleasantly surprised Thread-Index: oZn01sqXbFWr7D/tEobJaYSKSsZjfw== DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=comcast.net; s=q20140121; t=1425990394; bh=rBhFpOo61qhnsg0LTj2UX7XQm6K+b7gcBvEksqxnT4Q=; h=Received:Received:Date:From:To:Message-ID:Subject:MIME-Version: Content-Type; b=X69wxxUyjr6V6uofOLkXLTh97taJCLOGy2bqjcOZMhWcqr1kR4EPslNOUEZk8Yql7 V1ol2hszLAJwIZ+CcjBmJymxgaYRNo46rEChlb3DLjhiWIl++BdqYaXZq1U837gh7q eaXWKT/8zDzSrGwpG1LE6vNEh3nSBwY1SS6/oWxjUM9XEv4ylnkGw4BccNqWF13NED popjrX5EhNE2ghZjIJ4fcbKzK38i21Fkv7ny4eynEpT83Fv9g3tD7FaA9xpu3NZECp ahiLewNjkA2PxqjnERbQ54wOmC6ExbIoFY6++lrmeKr8B/a5DwH5HzvNaDDpND9mhJ aWLAcElNbCMtw== ----- END EMAIL HEADER ONE -----
----- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ONE ----- From: paul.castro@comcast.net; To: [REDACTED] Date: Tue Mar 10 12:26:33 GMT 2015 Subject: Pleasantly surprised Attachment: Pleasantly surprised.zip ----- END EMAIL BODY ONE -----

This is the second of two email examples. The email included the same .zip archive attachment named "Pleasantly surprised.zip" (MD5: 69A2F92A33B8BD9740434DE3F95F4332).
----- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER TWO ----- DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; q=dns; c=nofws; s=dk20050327; d=earthlink.net; b=G/TzSF6ls8dMrnJtteEXf2kzNrEohS/aI4QxjSbqXZ3uLlfZQjJo4NnwebkDhE4/; h=Message-ID:Date:From:Reply-To:To:Subject:Mime-Version:Content-Type:X-Mailer:X-ELNK-Trace:X-Originating-IP; Received: from [209.86.224.26] (helo=mswamui-bichon.atl.sa.earthlink.net) by elasmtp-spurfowl.atl.sa.earthlink.net with esmtpa (Exim 4.67) (envelope-from <debfloyd54@earthlink.net>) id 1YVIGK-0005pq-Is; Tue, 10 Mar 2015 07:23:48 -0400 Received: from 192.253.229.37 by webmail.earthlink.net with HTTP; Tue, 10 Mar 2015 07:23:48 -0400 Message-ID: <17259701.1425986628346.JavaMail.root@mswamui-bichon.atl.sa.earthlink.net> Date: Tue, 10 Mar 2015 19:23:48 +0800 (GMT+08:00) From: [REDACTED] <debfloyd54@earthlink.net> Reply-To: [REDACTED] <debfloyd54@earthlink.net> To: [REDACTED] Subject: Pleasantly surprised Mime-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_139_1830125.1425986628090" X-Mailer: EarthLink Zoo Mail 1.0 X-ELNK-Trace: 48f22812b7a7e1ab18814d73f659084e239a348a220c2609e1174b53885f93f1e 4da977a21b8c0cc666fa475841a1c7a350badd9bab72f9c350badd9bab72f9c X-Originating-IP: 209.86.224.26 ----- END EMAIL HEADER TWO -----
----- BEGIN EMAIL BODY TWO ----- From: [REDACTED] <debfloyd54@earthlink.net>; To: [REDACTED] Date: Tue Mar 10 11:23:48 GMT 2015 Subject: Pleasantly surprised Attachment: Pleasantly surprised.zip ----- END EMAIL BODY TWO -----
The observed file attachment is a ZIP archive file that contains the malicious executable "Pleasantly surprised.Exe".

This is the executable Gh0st RAT file contained in the attachment. It has an image icon that resembles a "play" button. The executable takes the following action when launched:
-It moves and renames itself to "C:\WINDOWS\Temp\WinLogon.exe".
-It writes "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Windpdate.txt".
-It then moves "Windpdate.txt" to "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\WinInit.url" for persistence.
-It then creates the mutex "MyKeepLive0303".
-It creates the keylog file "C:\WINDOWS\system32\ky1log.dat".
Once the process is completed, it performs a DNS query for www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com, and then attempts to connect via port 707. If successful, it sends out encrypted or encoded victim system information.
After the mutex is created, the keylog file "C:\WINDOWS\system32\ky1log.dat" is created. The file hash and size of this file will change as content is written to it.

After "Windpdate.txt" is written to "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\", it is moved to "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\WinInit.url" for persistence. Windupdate.txt contains the following data:
[InternetShortcut] URL=C:\Windows\Temp\WinLogon.exe

cybox:Properties.FileObj:File_Path: C:\Documents and Settings\AllC:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\
